CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 1, 1954, pg. 20 reads: "Pittsburgh Group In Cast Of "Aida" - With practice sessions already underway the finest handpicked voices of the District have been recruited to support a glittering array of nationally known vocalists in a coming presentation of the opera Aida at the Syria Mosque. Mme. Mary Cardwell Dawson, president and founder of the National Negro Opera Foundation is in city and stationed at the local NNOF branch guild office 2601 Centre Street where auditions are being held.  The group above will be seen when the stirring opera is presented here within the next several weeks.  Left to right, first row of dancers, Shirley Van Holt, Juanita Baskin, Marine Drake, Yvonne Kershain, Alberta Thompson, Mamie Hamilton, Delores Stewart; Center: Yvonne Jones, Victor Hereford, Sylvia Davis, Brenadine Pressley, Beverly Scott, Barbara Stout, Jackalyn Lewis, Loretta, Lois Jean Daugen.  Second row, left to right: Phillip Littlejohn, Signora Smith, Edith Washington, Bernice Grace, Gloria Grate, Lorretta Johnson, Lillian Worthy, Martine Dalton, Kathlyn Handy.  Third row, left to right: Mary Jackson, Jean Jefferson, Julia Coleman, Mrs. Kellum, Vivian Hughes, Carol, Elsie Paige, Ethel Littlejohn, Mrs. O'Labrice C. Beckom, Norman Hardy, Mary Ann Burncheck, Ezra Murphy, Doris Chambers, Juanita Nadjudher, Lillian Jordan and Thelma Scott."
TitMainTitle: Woman singing in front of of National Negro Opera Company cast of "Aida" wearing exotic and ballet costumes, posed on stage of Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall, closer version

cutline: Pittsburgh Group In Cast Of "Aida" - With practice sessions already underway the finest handpicked voices of the District have been recruited to support a glittering array of nationally known vocalists in a coming presentation of the opera Aida at the Syria Mosque. Mme. Mary Cardwell Dawson, president and founder of the National Negro Opera Foundation is in city and stationed at the local NNOF branch guild office 2601 Centre Street where auditions are being held.  The group above will be seen when the stirring opera is presented here within the next several weeks.  Left to right, first row of dancers, Shirley Van Holt, Juanita Baskin, Marine Drake, Yvonne Kershain, Alberta Thompson, Mamie Hamilton, Delores Stewart; Center: Yvonne Jones, Victor Hereford, Sylvia Davis, Brenadine Pressley, Beverly Scott, Barbara Stout, Jackalyn Lewis, Loretta, Lois Jean Daugen.  Second row, left to right: Phillip Littlejohn, Signora Smith, Edith Washington, Bernice Grace, Gloria Grate, Lorretta Johnson, Lillian Worthy, Martine Dalton, Kathlyn Handy.  Third row, left to right: Mary Jackson, Jean Jefferson, Julia Coleman, Mrs. Kellum, Vivian Hughes, Carol, Elsie Paige, Ethel Littlejohn, Mrs. O'Labrice C. Beckom, Norman Hardy, Mary Ann Burncheck, Ezra Murphy, Doris Chambers, Juanita Nadjudher, Lillian Jordan and Thelma Scott.

SCORE AND SEVEN YEARS7
WE ARE ENGAGED IN A GREAT CIVIL WAR, TESTING
WAR. WE HAVE COME TO DEDICATE A PORTION OF THAT FIELD AS A FINAL RESTIN
GROUND.
DO THIS,BUT,IN A LARGER SENSE WE CANNOT DEDICATE-WE CANOT CONSECRATE-WE
T. THE WORLD WILL LITTLE NOTE, NOR LONG REMEMBER, WHAT WE SAY HER
BLY ADVANCED
HAVE CONSE
CRATED IT. FAR ABOVE OUR POOR POWER
TO ADD OR DETRAC
DA US,TIE LIVING RATHER,TO BE DEDICATED HERE TO THE UNFINISHED WORK WHICH THEY WHO
T TASK REMAINING BEFORE US-THAT FROM TH
ESE HONORED DEAD WE TAKE INCREASED DEVOTION TO THAT CAUSE FOR WHICH THEY GAVE THE
HICHLY RESOLVE THAT THESE DEAD SHALL NOT HAVE DIED IN VAIN-THAT THIS NATION, UNDER GOD, SHALL HAVE A NEW BIRTH OF FRE
E PEOPLE, FOR THE PEOPLE, SHALL NOT PERISH FROM THE EARTH.
GETTYSBURG, NOVEMBER 19, 1863.
